jparsec.vo

Class ADSQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.vo.ADSQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ADSQuery
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to send queries to ADS abstracts service.

    A simple example to retrieve a bibtex entry is:

    try {
    query = ADSQuery.ADS_HARVARD_URL;
    query += ADSQuery.addParameter(ADSQuery.PARAMETER.BIBCODE, "2007A&A...470..625D");
    query += "&" +ADSQuery.addParameter(ADSQuery.PARAMETER.DATATYPE, ADSQuery.DATATYPE.BIBTEX.getType());

    String out = ADSQuery.query(query);
    System.out.println(out);
    } catch (Exception e)
    {
    e.printStackTrace();
    }

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addParameter

        public static java.lang.String addParameter(ADSQuery.PARAMETER parameter,
                            java.lang.String value)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Allows to add a parameter to the query.

        From the second parameter in necessary to add the ampersand '&' to separate the different parameters.

        Parameters:
        parameter - Parameter ID.
        value - Parameter value.
        Returns:
        Code for the added parameter.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getAuthorQuery

        public static java.lang.String getAuthorQuery(java.lang.String authorName,
                              int year0,
                              int yearf)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Returns a query to retrieve all articles for a given author.
        Parameters:
        authorName - Author name, for instance "Alonso-Albi, T.".
        year0 - The initial year for the search, for instance 2000.
        yearf - The final year for the search.
        Returns:
        The string query.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
